verses.verse: A Psalm of David. Blessed <WH1288> be Jehovah <WH3068> my rock <WH6697>, Who teacheth <WH3925> my hands <WH3027> to war <WH7128>, And my fingers <WH676> to fight <WH4421>:

My lovingkindness <WH2617>, and my fortress <WH4686>, My high tower <WH4869>, and my deliverer <WH6403>; My shield <WH4043>, and he in whom I take refuge <WH2620>; Who subdueth <WH7286> my people under me <WH5971>.
Jehovah <WH3068>, what is man <WH120>, that thou takest knowledge <WH3045> of him <WH1121>? Or the son of man <WH582>, that thou makest account of him <WH2803>?
Man <WH120> is like <WH1819> to vanity <WH1892>: His days <WH3117> are as a shadow <WH6738> that passeth away <WH5674>.
Bow <WH5186> thy heavens <WH8064>, O Jehovah <WH3068>, and come down <WH3381>: Touch <WH5060> the mountains <WH2022>, and they shall smoke <WH6225>.
Cast forth <WH1299> lightning <WH1300>, and scatter <WH6327> them <WH7971>; Send out thine arrows <WH2671>, and discomfit them <WH2000>.
Stretch <WH7971> forth thy hand <WH3027> from above <WH4791>; Rescue <WH5337> me <WH5337>, and deliver me out of great <WH7227> waters <WH4325>, Out of the hand <WH3027> of <WH5236> aliens <WH1121>;
Whose mouth <WH6310> speaketh <WH1696> deceit <WH7723>, And whose right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood <WH8267>.
I will sing <WH7891> a new <WH2319> song <WH7892> unto thee <WH430>, O God: Upon a psaltery <WH5035> of ten strings <WH6218> will I sing praises unto thee <WH2167>.
Thou art he that giveth <WH5414> salvation <WH8668> unto kings <WH4428>; Who rescueth <WH6475> David <WH1732> his servant <WH5650> from the hurtful <WH7451> sword <WH2719>.

Rescue <WH6475> me <WH5337>, and deliver me out of the hand <WH3027> of <WH5236> aliens <WH1121>, Whose mouth <WH6310> speaketh <WH1696> deceit <WH7723>, And whose right hand <WH3225> is a right hand <WH3225> of falsehood <WH8267>.

When our sons <WH1121> shall be as plants <WH5195> grown up <WH1431> in their youth <WH5271>, And our daughters <WH1323> as corner-stones <WH2106> hewn <WH2404> after the fashion <WH8403> of a palace <WH1964>;
When our garners <WH4200> are full <WH4392>, affording <WH6329> all manner of store <WH2177>, And our sheep <WH6629> bring forth thousands <WH503> and ten thousands <WH503> in our fields <WH2351>;
When our oxen <WH441> are well laden <WH5445>; When there is no breaking in <WH6556>, and no going forth <WH3318>, And no outcry <WH6682> in our streets <WH7339>:
Happy <WH835> is the people <WH5971> that is in such a case <WH3602>; Yea <WH835>, happy is the people <WH5971> whose God <WH430> is Jehovah <WH3068>.
